radiographic_examinations.findings: Malrotation of the left extrarenal pelvis, multiple cortical defects in the left kidney consistent with scarring, mildly enlarged spleen (14.8 cm), prominent periportal, mesenteric, inguinal, and retroperitoneal lymph nodes (up to 1.4 cm), trace free fluid in the pelvis.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: Persistent mild splenomegaly with peripheral wedge-shaped areas of hypoattenuation consistent with infarcts; other findings unchanged.

radiographic_examinations.findings: Low lung volumes with no opacities suggestive of pneumonia.

radiographic_examinations.procedure_name: Ultrasonography of kidneys and venous system
radiographic_examinations.findings: Normal with no evidence of hydronephrosis or deep venous thrombosis.

radiographic_examinations.procedure_name: Repeat CT scan of the abdomen and pelvis
radiographic_examinations.findings: Persistent splenomegaly with wedge-shaped areas of hypoenhancement in the spleen consistent with splenic infarcts; other findings unchanged from the CT performed on admission.

radiographic_examinations.procedure_name: CT scan three months after discharge
radiographic_examinations.findings: Spleen returned to normal size with almost complete resolution of all focal defects.
